Josh Glaser

Contact

j-glaser@u.northwestern.edu

Google Scholar Profile

Background

  • I recently finished my PhD in the Northwestern University Integrated Neuroscience (NUIN) program.
  • As an undergraduate, I majored in Physics and Math at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign.

Current projects

  • Using machine learning techniques, including neural networks, for neural decoding
  • Understanding movement planning and execution during natural behavior
    • Understanding FEF activity during eye movements in natural scenes (In collaboration with the Segraves Lab)
    • Understanding PMd and M1 activity during reaching movements in naturalistic experiments (In collaboration with the Miller Lab)
  • Using motion tracking to understand how proprioceptive inputs are represented in the brain (In collaboration with the Miller Lab)
